Yes. For a variety of reasons. To begin with, there is a phenomenon called “assortative mating”: people tend to mate with partners with similar personality traits. High IQ people usually belong to certain personality types.  Pretty much all of these personality types are relatively rare, so that is the first big obstacle in finding a partner.High IQ people are usually highly passionate about what they do. They might easily miss other compatible people who are passionate about something completely different (say, movie making, a certain sport, astrophysics or linguistics)High IQ might for the same reason not consider less intelligent people of compatible personality types as partners if they don’t find common ground.A lot depends on the environment. If high IQ people work e.g. in academia it might be relatively easy for them to find a partner (NB: the majority of people would have found a partner much earlier, say in the last years of high school).If a high IQ person lives, say in a small village, they might never find a partner, particularly if they are female. This would be the typical old spinster from in the olden days. Read more here: The evolutionary psychology of attraction and personality types: r/K selected mating strategies according to subsistence economy

Less than who? Other unintelligent women? Or intelligent men? Intelligent women face the same challenges as anyone else, such as prejudice and sexism. And what works for others also works for them, self love, optimism and willingness to share their life with someone. Marriage does not require people to be dumb. What it does need is two partners who love and respect each other and treat each other as equals. Being intelligent and compassionate are not mutually exclusive. By that measure, intelligent women are just as capable of making a marriage work as any other person. Such statements are said to pacify ginormous male egos by men and women alike. The only truth that can be inferred from such beliefs is that intelligent women are definitely more likely to show a male chauvinist his real place, rather than the throne he imagines himself entitled to.

I suspect that a lot of intelligent women find it difficult to find partners who are not intimidated by their intellect. One time on the subway I saw a young woman who was obviously a high-powered lawyer or consultant heading out to the airport, and she was engaged in very earnest conversation with a young man in a working-class uniform with a sewed-on nametag that might have said “Bill” or “James” or “Raoul”. She was very pretty, and I was much impressed that she seemed to think that this young man was worth her time. I would have been much appreciative of an introduction to her, but I happened to have been married at the time.

Yes, intelligent women are more likely to be single because they have high expectations from their potential partner. These expectations tend to be utopian at times and the more intelligent the woman is, the lower will be her tolerance levels to any imperfections on the part of the partner. In this world no one is perfect, be it a man or a woman. Intelligent men tend to make allowances for imperfections and have no problems in comprising for the sake of a good, healthy and long lasting relationship. Intelligent women, on the other hand are very fussy about what they want and as a result they drive away potential partners.
